name: Native Edible Plants of Toronto Webinar
description: Blueberries, raspberries, strawberries: they aren't just found at the grocery store. There are native species of these fruits found in Toronto's ravines too!  Join avid fruit gardener and City of Toronto Forestry staffer Steven Parkes for a webinar on Toronto's native and edible fruiting plants, their ecological importance and where you might spot them in our urban wilderness. You'll learn how adding these plants to your local landscapes and private gardens can enhance habitats, support local wildlife and pollinators, while producing native fruits and nuts. Please note: this is not a foraging webinar. The focus will be on integrating native edible plants into private gardens. Please snack responsibly.

name: Steven Isserlis, cello and Connie Shih, piano

location.name: Jane Mallett Theatre, St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts

description:
These celebrated musicians are frequent collaborators, captivating audiences at world-class venues like Wigmore Hall, Carnegie Hall, and the Berlin Philharmonie. 

Beyond performance, Isserlis is a passionate teacher, author, and broadcaster. As Sir John Barbirolli said, "Steven Isserlis is a musician of immense talent and insight, whose sound and interpretation leave a deep and lasting impression."

Their thoughtfully curated program highlights Isserlis's broad musical interests, featuring the Ritournelle by Czech composer Vítězslava Kaprálová alongside beloved cello-piano repertoire gems. The program also includes Beethoven's 12 Variations on a Theme from The Magic Flute, Op. 66 and Sonata No. 3 in A major, Op. 69, Schumann's 3 Fantasiestücke, Op. 73, and Kabalevsky's Sonata. Experience an exceptional evening of profound musicianship and emotional depth from this outstanding duo.
